comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: Burroughs, Wellcome & Co were founded in 1880 as a pharmaceutical company. As you can see from the picture they were famous for their Kepler Cod liver oil in Malt extract, a more palatable way of getting vitamins and minerals into children. www.sciencemuseum.org.uk/broughttolife/objects/display.as... Sir Henry Wellcome used the fortune he made from the company to set up the Wellcome Trust, one of the biggest charitable trust devoted to research to improve human and animal health. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wellcome_Trust

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Nothing seems to be left from these factory buildings, see www.geograph.org.uk/photo/3175776

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Perhaps the low, peaked roof buildings at the far right are still there. Hard to be sure. maps.google.com/maps?q=dartford,+england&ie=UTF-8&...

comment.author: 9003948@N05
comment._content: The buildings here were only recently demolished, following the closure of the Burroughs Wellcome works. Though close to London, Dartford is most definitely in the county of Kent.
